text: how many people have really died in
different countries because of
coronavirus either directly or
indirectly it's really hard to be exact
but one of the best measures to use is
what's known as excess deaths that means
the number of deaths above what we might
expect to see in normal circumstances to
work it out you take the number of
people who've died from any cause in a
given period of time a week or a month
say you can then compare that with the
average number of deaths that occurred
in the same period usually over the
previous five years as an example we're
going to look at three countries with
high numbers of coronavirus deaths in
Europe and to try to make the comparison
more accurate we're taking an 8 week
period starting from the week in which
the fifth coronavirus death was recorded
in each country that means adding up the
number of deaths in the same eight-week
periods from 2015 to 2019 and dividing
by five to get an average the difference
between that average and the number we
have for 2020 is the excess deaths for
that eight-week period during the
pandemic it's still not a perfect
measure but in the UK that number is
about 50,000 928 in Italy it's 40,000
820 and in France its 27,000 522 and if
you turn those numbers into percentages
you know that in that period the UK had
54% more deaths than normal
Italy 43% more and France 29% more the
advantage of these numbers is that they
take a lot of other variables which make
comparisons between different countries
really difficult out of the equation you
don't have to think about whether one
country has done more coronavirus tests
than another or whether one has a
stricter definition than another of how
to count coronavirus deaths
you just know roughly how many more
people have died of any cause then you
would normally expect there are still
other factors to take into account if
you're comparing different countries as
well as asking if they reached the peak
of the outbreak at different times you
need to know if one has an older
population than another or if having had
so many excess deaths early in the year
they will now have far fewer next winter
so statisticians are never entirely
satisfied but measuring excess deaths
gives you a pretty good idea of what's
been going on
[Music]
